summary:
Accomplished, versatile international marketing and sales management professional adept at building cohesive, high performing teams that achieve personal and organizational objectives and goals. Good communication and people skills, able to build rapport and connect with individuals from diverse backgrounds and at all professional levels. Skilled at identifying emerging opportunities and capitalizing on them for greater revenues and market share.
Results focused innovative leader with extensive work experience in the Oil and Gas services, marine logistics, onshore logistics and International trade. 20 year international experience facilitating change management, process improvements, organizational integration and system implementation. Global work experience as project leader with assignments based in Cameroon, Chad, Venezuela, UAE, Nigeria and Netherlands. Leadership skills demonstrated during management of a culturally diverse team. Strategic perspective connecting value with solutions. Clients included Oil & Gas companies, engineering companies, Drilling and supply companies. 

Business Development and customer care leadership experience. Communication and negotiation skills in adverse and cyclical situations. Proficient in Marketing / Sales / Commercial perspective of Offshore shipping industry.
Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) compliance, Health Safety (HSE) and Security leader within the offshore marine logistics support industry.

Strengths and Areas of Expertise: Leadership, Relationship development, policy implementation, problem solving analysis, collaborative solution identification, team building and strategy execution, Sales & Marketing, New Market Expansion, Organization & Communication, Negotiation, Data Analysis, Public Relations

Fluent (trilingual) in French, English and Spanish

education.field_of_study: Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services

profile_positions.title: Vice President of International Sales - Eastern Hemisphere

profile_positions.description:
-	Develop relationships and market assets to none Americas based customers (ie: Eastern Hemisphere)
-	Business development in Europe, Sub Saharan Africa, MENA, APAC.
-	Supervision on the centralized tenders.
-	Key account management with major clients.
-	Competition and market Analysis
-	Link between operating areas and customer corporate offices.
-	Work on marketing tools (Design of new vessel specification sheets, Participate in website update, etc….). 
-	Review and negotiation of master frame agreements, contracts, charter-parties and other legal / commercial documents. 
-	Assistance and supervision to the commercial departments. 
-	Participate in kick-off meetings and operational meetings/reviews with clients.
-	Contribute to the development of the company’s management, QA systems and risk management/loss prevention programs by reporting, developing and improving procedures, ensuring smooth communication with departments and various parties involved in execution of the company’s contractual obligations
profile_positions.title: Director of International Sales and Marketing, Eastern Hemisphere

profile_positions.description:
-	Leading an organization covering at any given time, 7 to 12 active countries, 35 to 50 vessels and $150 to $220 million in annual revenue, 100 to 120 office staff and 600 to 800 mariners
-	Accountable for all aspects of Tidewater’s business interest in the Central, West and East African regions (Excluding Angola and Nigeria). 
-	Client and Joint Venture partner relations
-	Development of market presence 
-	Responsibility for Personnel, financial performance, operations, safety, service delivery, legal and regulatory compliance all reflected in P&L results. 
-	Worked in a complex business environment requiring a high level of knowledge on local practices, legal constraints and in particular compliance matters such as FCPA and UK Anti-bribery regulations
-	Established new operating company and opened new office in Mozambique, Kenya, Tanzania and re-opened Ghana and EG offices.
-	Minimized vessel down time 
-	Developed and maintained client relationships.
-	Initiated Process improvement reviews for all key areas
-	Cost control management improving the bottom line
-	Safe and secure vessel operations
-	Managed multiple simultaneous dry-dockings of company vessels.
-	Established annually short- and medium-term (commercial) planning and budgets in co-operation with other departments
profile_positions.title: Area Manager - West Africa

profile_positions.description:
-      Leading an organization covering at any given time, 4 to 7 active countries, 22 to 35 vessels and $60 to $80 million in annual revenue, 35 to 40 office staff and 350 to 600 mariners
-	Accountable for all aspects of Tidewater’s business interest in the Middle East and India/Sri Lanka. 
-	Client and Joint Venture partner relations
-	Development of market presence 
-	Responsibility for Personnel, financial performance, operations, safety, service delivery, legal and regulatory compliance all reflected in P&L results. 
-	Worked on preparing the company to enter Saudi Arabia/Aramco, via a local JV and the supply of vessels built to client expectations. 
-	Minimized vessel down time 
-	Developed and maintained client relationships.
-	Initiated Process improvement reviews for all key areas
-	Cost control management improving the bottom line
-	Safe and secure vessel operations
-	Managed multiple simultaneous dry-dockings of company vessels.
-	Established annually short- and medium-term (commercial) planning and budgets in co-operation with other departments
profile_positions.title: Area Manager - Middle East and India

profile_positions.description:
- Created the Commercial Department in Douala Cameroon.
- Developed a proximity relationship with key clients
- Follow up on Vessel Contracts, Client Offers and Relations
- Business Development and Strategic Planning.
- Assisting Clients in Project planning / Vessel selections.
- Coordination with other departments on Vessel Operations / Execution & monitoring of Planning.
- Assistance in billing and receivables.
- Guardian of the top line. 
- Developed series of forms to improve communication between office and vessels. 
- Commercially responsible for a fleet of 25 to 35 vessels. 
- Worked on strategic planning of fleet employment, chartering and future strategic growth path. 
- Preparation, review and submission of tenders. 
- Client negotiation and management of charter party agreements.
- Directly involved in daily operational and technical vessel issues.
- Responsible for preparing monthly charter revenue recap plus reviewing and approving invoices 
- Foster a positive working climate between the different departments and offices within the company (including outside managers and their representatives) which have a day-to-day involvement with the operation of the fleet

•provides adequate control and reporting systems and develops measuring points and control instruments for all receivables on a monthly basis in order to assure timely and correct paymen
•have end responsibility for and manage the overall customer relationships, including collection of hires and the settlement of claims and other issues as and where appropriate ts.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Manager - West Africa
